update.description:
For example:

old:
~~~
roslaunch drcsim_gazebo atlas_v4.launch
~~~

new:
~~~
roslaunch drcsim_gazebo atlas.launch model_args:="_v4"
~~~
update.title: simplify launch files

content.raw:
The irobot hands do not appear for me.


```
#!c++

[Err] [SystemPaths.cc:400] File or path does not exist[""]
[Err] [Visual.cc:2359] No mesh specified
[Err] [ModelDatabase.cc:408] Unable to download model[model://irobot_hand_description/meshes/finger_base.stl]

```
content.html:
The irobot hands do not appear for me.

[Err] [SystemPaths.cc:400] File or path does not exist[""]
[Err] [Visual.cc:2359] No mesh specified
[Err] [ModelDatabase.cc:408] Unable to download model[model://irobot_hand_description/meshes/finger_base.stl]

content.raw:
there's a `inertia_args` param:
~~~
roslaunch drcsim_gazebo atlas.launch model_args:="_v3" inertia_args:="_with_v1_inertia"
~~~
let me try that...
content.html:
there's a inertia_args param:

roslaunch drcsim_gazebo atlas.launch model_args:="_v3" inertia_args:="_with_v1_inertia"

let me try that...

content.raw:
retargeted to 4.1.

I'll merge from 4.1 back to default.

content.raw: Should this pull request target 4.1, since it's adding in the Robotiq hand model (which isn't currently in default)? Why isn't the Robotiq hand in default again?
content.html: Should this pull request target 4.1, since it's adding in the Robotiq hand model (which isn't currently in default)? Why isn't the Robotiq hand in default again?

content.raw: Note that `roslaunch drcsim_gazebo atlas.launch model_args:="_v3_with_v1_inertia"` doesn't work because there is no `atlas_v3_with_v1_inertia_bringup.launch` (presumably because this model's bringup is the same as atlas V3). There is still an `atlas_v3_with_v1_inertia.urdf`. Should the logic be changed a bit so that this model can still be launched?
content.html: Note that roslaunch drcsim_gazebo atlas.launch model_args:="_v3_with_v1_inertia" doesn't work because there is no atlas_v3_with_v1_inertia_bringup.launch (presumably because this model's bringup is the same as atlas V3). There is still an atlas_v3_with_v1_inertia.urdf. Should the logic be changed a bit so that this model can still be launched?

content.raw: Will we need to change the drcsim tests? @\_jrivero\_
content.html: Will we need to change the drcsim tests? @_jrivero_

content.raw:
I found some issues with `atlas_irobot_hands` and `atlas_irobot_hands_bringup` launchfiles, as well as with sandia_hands, that were causing the xml syntax errors Carlos was seeing. Fix is in branch [reorganize_launch_files_jackie](#!/osrf/drcsim/branch/reorganize_launch_files_jackie)

I also had an issue where Gazebo couldn't find the iRobot hand meshes. Will investigate further.
content.html:
I found some issues with atlas_irobot_hands and atlas_irobot_hands_bringup launchfiles, as well as with sandia_hands, that were causing the xml syntax errors Carlos was seeing. Fix is in branch reorganize_launch_files_jackie

I also had an issue where Gazebo couldn't find the iRobot hand meshes. Will investigate further.

content.raw: confirmed, that's because `atlas_sandia_hands` and `atlas_irobot_hands` are missing `_v4` variation. Will add them.
content.html: confirmed, that's because atlas_sandia_hands and atlas_irobot_hands are missing _v4 variation. Will add them.

content.raw:
I can launch all the Atlas versions with atlas.launch and atlas_robotiq_hands but not with sandia or irobot hands. I got this error:

```
#!c++
Invalid roslaunch XML syntax: mismatched tag: line 38, column 4
The traceback for the exception was written to the log file
```
content.html:
I can launch all the Atlas versions with atlas.launch and atlas_robotiq_hands but not with sandia or irobot hands. I got this error:

Invalid roslaunch XML syntax: mismatched tag: line 38, column 4
The traceback for the exception was written to the log file
